Package model

Class SongDAO

java.lang.Object
model.SongDAO
public class SongDAO
extends java.lang.Object
This class manages all the connections to the database in order get, delete and update information about the songs table of the database. Some of the methods of this class include obtaining information give a song id and/or a user id.
See Also:
ConnectorDB, ResultSet, Config, Song, BasicInfoSong

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SongDAO()
    a default constructor to be able to have an instance of this class and access it's methods from other classes
    SongDAO​(Config configuration)
    This method allows to connect to the database as well as initialize an object of this class

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addSong​(Song song)
    This method adds a new song to the database.
    void changePermissionBySongId​(int songId)
    This method allows the user to change the privacy of a song (set if the song is public or private) IMPORTANT: If this method wants to be used to rename a song from the user side, first it must be checked that the user has permission to perform the desired action by using the checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId(int songId, int userId) method
    void checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId​(int songId, java.lang.String userId)
    Method used to verify if the user has permission on a specific song
    void deleteSongById​(int songId)
    This method is used to delete a song.
    java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getAllPublicSongs()
    This method gets all the public songs in an array list of type BasicInfoSong which only has the title and the id
    java.util.ArrayList<Song> getAllSongs()
    This method gets all the songs in an array list of type BasicInfoSong which only has the title and the id
    java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getAllSongsByUserId​(java.lang.String id)
    This method allows to get all the basic info of songs (public and private) of one user
    java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getPublicSongsByUserId​(java.lang.String id)
    This method returns all the basic information (only title and id) of the public songs of one user
    Song getSongById​(int idSong)
    Private method that gets a song by id, if it exists, without having to check which user is demanding this action.
    java.util.ArrayList<Statistics> getStatistics()
    This method to get all the statistics in an ArrayList of Statistics.
    void getStatisticsTotalSongs()
    this method updates the totals of the statistics
    java.util.ArrayList<Song> getTopSongs()
    This method obtains the top 5 most played songs which is determined by the number of times a song has been played
    Song playSongById​(int idSong)
    This method returns a Song object given a song id.
    void renameSongTitleById​(int songId, java.lang.String newTitle)
    This method allows the rename a song title IMPORTANT: If this method wants to be used to rename a song from the user side, first it must be checked that the user has permission to perform the desired action by using the checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId(int songId, int userId) method
    static void setCallback​(MusicCallback callback)

  • Constructor Details

    • SongDAO

      public SongDAO​(Config configuration)
      This method allows to connect to the database as well as initialize an object of this class
      Parameters:
      configuration - contains the information that allows to connect to the database
      See Also:
      Config, ConnectorDB

    • SongDAO

      public SongDAO()
      a default constructor to be able to have an instance of this class and access it's methods from other classes

  • Method Details

    • setCallback

      public static void setCallback​(MusicCallback callback)

    • addSong

      public void addSong​(Song song) throws UserNotFoundException
      This method adds a new song to the database.
      Parameters:
      song - Includes the information about the song that will be added
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - user has not been found in the database

    • getSongById

      public Song getSongById​(int idSong) throws SongIdNotFoundException
      Private method that gets a song by id, if it exists, without having to check which user is demanding this action. The primarily use of this method is for purposes such as retrieving information for the statistics and the top 5 songs which are two functionalities that all users have access to.
      Parameters:
      idSong - id of the song
      Returns:
      Song which contains all the information of the song
      Throws:
      SongIdNotFoundException - thrown when the id of the demanded song is not found in the database

    • playSongById

      public Song playSongById​(int idSong) throws SongIdNotFoundException
      This method returns a Song object given a song id. NOTE: This method also increments the time this song has been played
      Parameters:
      idSong - the id of the song that the user is looking for
      Returns:
      a Song object which contains all the information regarding the song selected by id
      Throws:
      SongIdNotFoundException - this exception is thrown in case the id of the song is not found in the databas

    • checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId

      public void checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId​(int songId, java.lang.String userId) throws UserNotFoundException, UserDoesNotHavePermissionException, SongIdNotFoundException
      Method used to verify if the user has permission on a specific song
      Parameters:
      songId - id of the song
      userId - id of the user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - user was not found in the database
      UserDoesNotHavePermissionException - user does not have permissions
      SongIdNotFoundException - song was not found in the database

    • deleteSongById

      public void deleteSongById​(int songId) throws SongIdNotFoundException, DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException
      This method is used to delete a song. IMPORTANT: If this method wants to be used to delete a song from the user side, first it must be checked that the user has permission to perform the desired action by using the checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId(int songId, int userId) method
      Throws:
      SongIdNotFoundException - exception thrown when the id of the song is not found
      UserNotFoundException - user has not been found in the database
      DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException - exception thrown if either the user or server wants to delete a default song

    • renameSongTitleById

      public void renameSongTitleById​(int songId, java.lang.String newTitle) throws SongIdNotFoundException, DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException
      This method allows the rename a song title IMPORTANT: If this method wants to be used to rename a song from the user side, first it must be checked that the user has permission to perform the desired action by using the checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId(int songId, int userId) method
      Parameters:
      songId - id of the song that wants to be renamed
      newTitle - new title to replace current title
      Throws:
      SongIdNotFoundException - song id not found in the database
      DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException - exception thrown if either the user or server wants to rename a default song

    • changePermissionBySongId

      public void changePermissionBySongId​(int songId) throws SongIdNotFoundException, DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException
      This method allows the user to change the privacy of a song (set if the song is public or private) IMPORTANT: If this method wants to be used to rename a song from the user side, first it must be checked that the user has permission to perform the desired action by using the checkUserPermissionsByUserIdAndSongId(int songId, int userId) method
      Parameters:
      songId - id of the song
      Throws:
      SongIdNotFoundException - thrown when the id of the song has not been found in the database
      UserDoesNotHavePermissionException - thrown if the user is not the one who uploaded that song
      UserNotFoundException - user has not been found in the database
      DefaultSongCanNotBeModifiedException - exception thrown if either the user or server wants to change permission of a default song

    • getPublicSongsByUserId

      public java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getPublicSongsByUserId​(java.lang.String id) throws UserNotFoundException
      This method returns all the basic information (only title and id) of the public songs of one user
      Parameters:
      id - id of the user
      Returns:
      an array of all the basic information of the public songs of that user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - user has not been found in the database
      See Also:
      BasicInfoSong, ArrayList

    • getAllPublicSongs

      public java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getAllPublicSongs()
      This method gets all the public songs in an array list of type BasicInfoSong which only has the title and the id
      Returns:
      an array list of all the public songs
      See Also:
      BasicInfoSong, ArrayList

    • getAllSongs

      public java.util.ArrayList<Song> getAllSongs()
      This method gets all the songs in an array list of type BasicInfoSong which only has the title and the id
      Returns:
      an array list of all the public songs
      See Also:
      BasicInfoSong, ArrayList

    • getAllSongsByUserId

      public java.util.ArrayList<BasicInfoSong> getAllSongsByUserId​(java.lang.String id) throws UserNotFoundException
      This method allows to get all the basic info of songs (public and private) of one user
      Parameters:
      id - id of the user
      Returns:
      an array list of type BasicInfoSong with all the songs of a user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - user has not been found in the database
      See Also:
      BasicInfoSong, ArrayList

    • getTopSongs

      public java.util.ArrayList<Song> getTopSongs()
      This method obtains the top 5 most played songs which is determined by the number of times a song has been played
      Returns:
      returns an ArrayList of BasicInfoSong of the 5 songs that have been played the most. The ArrayList is ordered by times played in descending order. If there aren't five song in the database, then it will return null in all the positions (if there are no songs) or just a few null positions if there are a less than 5 songs.
      See Also:
      BasicInfoSong, ArrayList

    • getStatistics

      public java.util.ArrayList<Statistics> getStatistics() throws StatisticsEmptyException
      This method to get all the statistics in an ArrayList of Statistics. NOTE: if there are no stats yet in the database, the ArrayList will be empty.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList with all the statistics
      Throws:
      StatisticsEmptyException - it is thrown when there are no statistics in the database
      See Also:
      ArrayList, Statistics

    • getStatisticsTotalSongs

      public void getStatisticsTotalSongs() throws StatisticsEmptyException
      this method updates the totals of the statistics
      Throws:
      StatisticsEmptyException - it is thrown when there are no statistics in the database
      See Also:
      ArrayList, Statistics
